description: York secure a third straight victory to keep in touch with the top of the National League table as they beat Fylde.
title: Fylde 1-3 York City
maintext:
York secured a third straight victory to keep in touch with the top of the National League table as they beat Fylde.
The visitors to Mill Farm were given the chance to take the lead on the stroke of half-time as they were awarded a penalty and Ollie Pearce made no mistake slotting home to give York the advantage at the interval.
York strengthened their grip on proceedings in the 74th minute when Joe Felix reacted first to a ball in the box and finished neatly to make it two. Malachi Fagan-Walcott added a third for the Minstermen before Nick Haughton pulled one back for the hosts.
However it was nothing more than a consolation goal as York cruised to victory and kept leaders Barnet in their sights.
